thread.title: UN looks at donations linked to bribery scandal
thread.title_full: UN looks at donations linked to bribery scandal | News24

author: news24.com
title: UN looks at donations linked to bribery scandal
text:
New York - The United Nations said on Wednesday it was looking into donations made by a foundation whose CEO was arrested for her role in a wide-ranging bribery scheme also involving former General Assembly president John Ashe.
The Global Sustainability Foundation headed by Sheri Yan, one of six people charged in the scandal along with Ashe, gave at least $1.5m to the UN office for South-South Co-operation.
"They are taking an active look and will look as deeply as possible into the money, where it went and what it was used for," UN spokesperson Stephane Dujarric told reporters.
Ashe was arrested on Tuesday and accused of taking $1.3m in bribes from wealthy Chinese developer Ng Lap Seng to promote the construction of a UN conference centre in Macau.
